summary:
## Solution Overview
Our proposed solution leverages cutting-edge technology to enhance operational efficiency and drive innovation in the life sciences sector. By integrating advanced analytics and machine learning, we provide a robust platform that supports data-driven decision-making. The solution is designed to be scalable, ensuring it meets both current and future needs of the organization.

## Technical Capabilities
The platform offers seamless integration with existing systems, ensuring minimal disruption during deployment. It is built on a secure, cloud-based architecture that provides high availability and redundancy. Our solution supports a wide range of data formats and includes powerful tools for data visualization and reporting, enabling users to gain insights quickly and effectively.

## Regulatory Compliance
We prioritize compliance with all relevant industry regulations, including HIPAA, GDPR, and 21 CFR Part 11. Our solution includes comprehensive audit trails and data encryption to ensure the highest levels of data security and privacy. Regular updates are provided to maintain compliance with evolving regulatory requirements.

## Implementation Timeline
The implementation process is structured to ensure a smooth transition and is typically completed within 12 to 16 weeks. Our dedicated project management team works closely with your organization to ensure all milestones are met on time. Post-implementation, we offer extensive training to ensure users are fully equipped to utilize the platform effectively.

## Key Differentiators
Our solution stands out due to its user-friendly interface, which requires minimal training for effective use. The platform’s ability to integrate with a wide range of third-party applications sets it apart from competitors. Additionally, our commitment to customer service ensures that clients receive ongoing support and customization as needed.

## Support and Maintenance
We provide 24/7 customer support with a dedicated team of experts ready to assist with any technical issues. Our maintenance package includes regular software updates and performance monitoring to ensure optimal system functionality. Clients also have access to an extensive knowledge base and user community for additional support resources.

Company Name: Cogstate
description: The document is a Contract Service Provider Questionnaire that includes inquiries about general company information, quality assurance, and other related aspects. It is structured in a tabular format where questions are posed with options for responses and comments.

qa_pairs.question: Describe your company’s general service offerings.
What products or services are or would you be providing to LEXEO?
How many years has your company been in business?
Describe any changes in corporate structure in the last five years (e.g., mergers, acquisitions, Initial Public Offering (IPO))
Describe any planned/announced changes in corporate structure.
Please provide the worldwide number of personnel, including contractors/consultants.
Please provide the number of employees, contractors, and consultants in the United States.
Please provide the number of employees, contractors, and consultants in the European Union.
What percentage of your workforce is temporary, contract or consultant?
Please provide a company organization chart that includes the reporting structure for your Quality Department.
What is the rate of employee turnover within the last five years? Which functional area has the highest turnover rate?
Is your company part of a larger group of companies?
Is your company, parent company(ies), or subsidiaries headquartered outside of the United States? If so, please specify.
Does your company maintain any licensures or accreditations (e.g., ISO, CAP, CLIA)? If so, please specify, along with expiration date.
Have any regulatory agencies inspected your company in the past 5 years? If yes, please attach relevant documentation.
Describe the structure, staffing and responsibilities of your Quality Department.
Name, Title, and contact information of Quality Department Head
What is the lead time for an onsite or remote audit?
Are written and signed job descriptions available for all roles with GXP responsibilities?
Are documented training and qualification requirements available for all GXP roles?
Please provide the procedure for new employee onboarding.
Are background and debarment checks performed for new employees?
What GXP and regulatory requirements (e.g., 21 CFR 312) are employees required to be trained on? At what frequency is refresher training required?
Are company personnel specifically trained to ALCOA++ principles for GXP data?
Please provide the Quality Policy, Quality Manual, and a list of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
Please describe your company’s Risk Management program.
If the Quality Management System (QMS) is electronic, please provide the system name, version, and evidence of the most recent validation.
Please provide the procedure for managing QMS documents such as SOPs and Work Instructions (WIs).
Please provide the procedure(s) for conducting internal and external audits and provide the annual audit plans for the last two years.
At what frequency does your company conduct Quality Management Review? Please provide evidence of the last three Quality Management Reviews.
Please provide your company’s Quality Issue/Deviation/Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA)/Customer Complaint/Data Integrity/Serious Breach procedure(s).
Does your company’s standard contractual language include reference to Serious Breach and General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)?
Does your company’s standard contractual language include regulatory compliance language (e.g., GCP, 21 CFR 11)?
Describe your process for selecting, qualifying, and managing vendors.
Please attach audit certificates for any vendors that will be used for LEXEO activities.
Does your company maintain an approved vendors list for vendors with GXP impact?
How does your company archive GXP records and information?
Please describe the retention period for all GXP records and describe the process and required approvals for record destruction.
Does your company have a written procedure for certified copies?

Does your company retain paper copies of GXP records? If yes, please provide details/specifications/floor plans of the archive space, including physical security, fire suppression, protection from water damage and natural disasters.
Who will be responsible for maintenance of LEXEO project documents?
How will LEXEO project documents be transferred to LEXEO at the conclusion of the project? Please describe all Quality Control (QC) steps that are required prior to transfer.
Per SOP, who will approve data and reports provided to LEXEO?
Does your organization provide or host a Trial Master File (TMF) for clinical studies? What system and what version is in use?
Is the TMF validated? Please provide evidence.
Does the system follow the structure of the TMF reference model?
Are sponsor personnel permitted to access the TMF? Please describe the process.
Is the TMF metadata included in the transfer of the TMF to LEXEO at the end of the study? Please describe the transfer process.
Does the LEXEO TMF undergo ongoing Quality Control? Please describe.
Does the TMF uses validated signatures?
Does your organization incorporate third party vendor documents into the TMF? Please describe the process and QC measures.
Are there any documents that your organization considers to be “Non-TMF” documents? If yes, please describe what they are and how they are managed.
Does the system follow the structure of the TMF reference model?
Are sponsor personnel permitted to access the TMF? Please describe the process.
Is the TMF metadata included in the transfer of the TMF to LEXEO at the end of the study? Please describe the transfer process.
Does the LEXEO TMF undergo ongoing Quality Control? Please describe.
Does the TMF use validated signatures?
Does your organization incorporate third party vendor documents into the TMF? Please describe the process and QC measures.
Are there any documents that your organization considers to be 'Non-TMF' documents? If yes, please describe what they are and how they are managed.
Are regulatory inspectors permitted access to the TMF? If so, please describe the process.
Does your organization maintain business continuity/disaster recovery plans?
At what frequency are these plans tested? Are tests performed desktop only? Please attach the last three tests.
Describe physical security for your facility, including frequency of user access review.
Do you have a pest control vendor? What is the frequency of checks?
Does your facility have access to backup power in the event of a power outage? For how many days?
What percentage of employees are in office versus remote?
Are logical security controls in place for electronic systems? Please describe.
How often are user access reviews conducted for company electronic systems?
Please provide the Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and Recovery Point Objective (RPO) for any electronic systems that will apply to the LEXEO project.
Has your company certified to FDA per 21 CFR 11.100 that electronic signatures are in use?
What system(s) does your company use for electronic signatures? How was it validated?
Is multifactor authentication (MFA) required to access company systems?
How frequently are password changes forced?
Does your company maintain a list of electronic systems with GXP impact? How often are systems reviewed?
What systems would house LEXEO data and information?
In what geographies (e.g., EU, USA) will LEXEO data be stored?
Does your company develop and validate computerized systems? What SOPs support this activity?
Describe how your company assesses and implements commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) software.
Are audit trails available for all GXP systems? Does your firm have procedures for review of audit trails based on system and data risk?
Does your company use GAMP 5Ò classification for electronic systems?
How are software issues reported by clinical sites or sponsors like LEXEO handled?
How long are help desk tickets retained for?
Does your company use any open-source software? If so, how is this managed and what procedures are in place?
Describe the process used for major and minor software release planning, testing and implementation.
Describe your company’s process for managing system downtime during patches or upgrades.
Describe the process for user training on software.
Are sponsors and regulatory authority inspectors able to access software validation information?
Does your company have a Data Privacy Officer?
Does your company have a Privacy Policy or SOP?
Does your company have assessment and reporting procedures for privacy or confidentiality breaches?
Does your company have procedures in place to segregate and protect unblinded trial data for blinded trials? Please describe.
Does your company have procedures in the event a trial participant withdraws consent?
Does your company maintain, control, and periodically update laboratory reference ranges?
Does your company maintain medical oversight and prompt reporting of critical lab values?
Does your company use validated shippers for shipment of laboratory samples?
Are your personnel trained to laboratory safety, Environmental Health and Safety and IATA standards?
Please provide a facility map/floorplan.
Please describe temperature/environmental monitoring controls in your facility.
Please describe equipment calibration, validation, and preventive maintenance procedures.
Please describe reagent purchase, formulation, QC, and management.
Please describe calibration standard management.
Please describe procedures for sample management and archive, including ongoing reconciliation with the clinical database.
Please describe method validation procedures, including accuracy, linearity, precision, specificity, limit of quantitation, etc.
Describe procedures for trial participant recruitment, including verification of identity and washout from other trials.
Describe consent procedures.
Describe arrangement for emergency care.
Describe medical oversight.
Describe “house rules” for any in-house portion of a clinical study.
Describe onsite laboratory capabilities and sample management/shipping process.
Describe pharmacy capabilities, including radioactive substances and compounding capabilities.
Describe your company’s participation in protocol development and clinical study report writing for sponsors.
What electronic data collection tools are used? Are they validated?
Describe the qualifications of personnel reviewing, handling, and assessing adverse events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs).
How are SAEs tracked and reconciled?
What metrics are reported to LEXEO regarding compliance with SAE reporting?
Describe the process for safety signal detection.
Describe the responsibilities and process for medical monitoring.
Identify the system used for safety case management and provide evidence of validation.
Including radioactive substances and compounding capabilities.

How are project decisions and communications archived?
How is project specific training identified, assigned, managed, and archived?
Describe the management of applicable external committees (e.g., safety review, dose escalation, Data Safety Monitoring Board, Blinded Independent Review Committee).
Describe your processes for onsite, remote, risk-based, and centralized monitoring.
Describe minimum monitor educational and training experience.
Describe monitoring onboarding and on the job training.
Describe escalation pathways and strategies for noncompliant sites and protocol deviations.
Describe how monitors confirm investigators have reviewed safety reports and submitted them to the applicable ethics committee.
Describe the Electronic Data Capture (EDC) system and provide evidence of validation.
Describe the management of coding dictionaries.
Describe data transfer processes and controls (incoming and outgoing).
Describe procedures and controls for database lock/unlock.
Describe version of statistical analysis programs used and describe validation.
Describe QC procedures for programs.
Describe management and delivery of datasets.
Describe procedures for development, review and approval of the Statistical Analysis Plan and outputs.
Describe templates used.
Describe version control.
Describe review and approval requirements.
Does your organization provide regulatory strategy or operations services?
What countries does your organization have expertise in?
Describe procedures used for CTIS and ClinicalTrials.gov.
Does your organization provide regulatory publishing or is this outsourced?
Does your organization provide regulatory strategy or operations services?
What countries does your organization have expertise in?

Does your organization provide regulatory publishing or is this outsourced?
